newsitem.title: JAPAN: Honda to boost car output in Aug, Sept.
newsitem.headline: Honda to boost car output in Aug, Sept.

text.p: Honda Motor Co Ltd said on Thursday it would boost domestic production in August and September to meet strong demand from the United States and to prepare for the launch of its remodelled Accord in the autumn.
Honda will produce 83,000 vehicles in August, up about 10,000 from a year earlier, and 109,000 vehicles in September, up 9,000 from the previous year, a Honda spokesman said.
Honda's No.1 and No.2 lines at its Sayama plant near Tokyo will operate for one or two extra days in August and two extra days in September, he said.
Its No.3 line at the Suzuka plant in Mie prefecture, in central Japan, will operate for one extra day in August and two extra days in September, he added.

Yachiyo Industry Co Ltd, owned 34.4 percent by Honda, will operate for three extra days each in August and September to keep up with strong domestic demand for Honda's Life 660cc multi-purpose minivehicle.
